Please note the following:

• This board desires high quality discussion. High quality posts will be praised. Low quality posts e.g. "Is this paranormal?" or "I am [insert paranormal entity here] ask me anything," etc. will be removed.
• Requests belong on >>>/wsr/.
• Conspiracy theories are welcome, but anything political in nature should be posted to >>>/pol/.
• For everything else, refer to global and board-specific rules.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Welcome to Divination General! Come here for readings and a discussion of theory/practice.

Every method is welcome: Tarot, Runes, Cartomancy, Scrying, Pendulum, Cleromancy, I-Ching, Oracles, Tasseomancy, Necromancy, etc.

>If you're NEW, please READ the STICKY:
http://pastebin.com/2Wp1Q074

>Recommended /div/ links and books:
https://pastebin.com/sAkg9cMz

>MEGA with Divination Books:
https://mega.nz/folder/Jp8gQD7Q#om_2lEm1GL0qPIpSrQgrvA

>Guides made by some of our readers:
•Rustig on how to start with tarot:
http://i.imgur.com/2rodLWB.png

•Thoth's tarot and rune guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ciFuMOVDIkA18d9Rw-Zkklgigx-Y4XzJkGVeMTYWcic/edit?pref=2&pli=1

•Hijinks' revised divination guide:
https://pastebin.com/Gv10KZUA

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Providing the gender of the people involved in your query can help it get answered accurately.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

Welcome to the Nobody General

>Who is the Nobody?
Nobody is just a guy alive today. He is many things; all of them are nothing that you couldn't have guessed. As an interdimensional man of destiny, his responsibility was to draw attention away from the true rulers of the universe. To that end his is the only Ego to have survived the The Destruction of Ego (albeit in a synthesized universe which was created especially for him). He used his position as an interdimensional man of destiny to steal the key that opened the locks that freed the beast that began the times of tribulations. He is also the inventor of some gubbmint secret stuff and is the only human-being alive whom the department of energy has the slightest bit of respect for, he believes.

Nobody has a successful business in secondhand succubi. This may be due to his discovery of a dimension where succubi escape to. If so, he employed an anon to sit in this now empty dimension denying the whole thing.

Grey ayys think he's really nice.

He's just like you, but he has found the kingdom of God within himself through sheer dedication, just like you will. He isn't a savior; remember that it's you who creates your own reality. With your hands, thoughts, feelings, words, you are the creator of your story. No one can decide your fate except for you and God. Remember your right to power, to step up into your ultimate role as your highest self, should you choose to embark on that journey.

>What is the general picture?
It’s important we start replying more to the good posters and educating the hateful ones, so call upon their heads the forces of Heaven for peace, clarity, and wisdom. None of us are perfect, it is by learning to admit and accept this fact one is able to learn, and grow in Truth. Heaven for all is real. The only motive is love.

If this is your first time here, just remember, it’s going to be ok, you may take shelter and find rest. If you are confused, you are paying attention.

1) Pic related, LoA teachers in general don't recommend an SP--in the sense of a person you know--for different reasons, mainly for it being pointless/limiting. They DO recommend just going for love in general and trust the subconscious to lead you to an ideal mate
2) It's limiting because you think you know what you want best, but the point of LoA is to understand that your conscious mind/ego doesn't really know all that, the subconscious knows much more and has a broader perspective on your happiness
3) We've seen this play out practically in these threads plenty of times, where the vast majority of people that report on an SP actually get relationship, but by the time they get the relationship they don't care about that person anymore. So chances are, you're actually wasting your time if you go for someone you know, and should just skip that step and go for love in general

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33610669
the eyepatch thing WILL work but anon has a big part of the explanation backwards
strengthening the ciliary will not improve your distance vision. being able to contract this muscle harder will only improve how closely you can 'pull' your focal plane.
the first "layer" of the nearsightedness problem (besides real genetic defect) is always ciliary spasm; cramp from over-use, basically. the muscle is denied sufficient opportunity to relax, and that is what the eyepatch routine is most immediately providing relief from.
OTOH, there absolutely is a problem with deformation of the ball-shape of the eye. this isn't merely a problem of muscular mis-management; the eye keeps itself 'in tune' by way of it's focus stimulus, and ciliary spasm combined with ongoing 'correction' lensing throws the tuning out of whack, and the eye grows into an increasingly-incorrect (elongated) shape. the part "big vision" omits is that this deformation IS reversible.
suggested reading for a compressed overview of this particular piece of the vision-correction issue:
https://www.losetheglasses.org/

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33617813
>On the topic of sigils, is there a difference between one you'd destroy and one you leave on a wall where you see it everyday. Is there a difference between statements of intent for these two?
Sigils are like placebos, they actually do nothing, it's your subconscious that gets the idea when you use them and makes things happen. A way to give her orders.
So, which one do you think works best? Burning it or looking at it every day? It depends on your beliefs.
>Also when your written statement is long, how do you choose letters to leave out?
This is a monkey paw method and a reason people discourage sigils around here. It's not that it manifests in the worst possible way, it's that it manifest in the way of least resistance, and in a literal manner that may not be what you wanted at all.
You could call it a failed manifestation, but if someone asked you "didn't you get exactly what your statement said?" and you'd have to answer "Yes.", because it technically did, that's the money paw.
To avoid it charge your sigil with the FEELING you want to have once it manifests, then there's no monkey paw because you manifest the feeling that it happened the way you wanted, even if you don't know yet what way that is.
Avoid words and letters, just make up a symbol that signifies that feeling. And, hey, you can use an already existing symbol, say, the Coca-cola Logo, or Youtube, whatever, every time you look at those you know it's manifesting your wish, so the world out there already has many copies of your sigil you'll look at naturally.

posts.name: Barggeist
posts.com:
>>33614377

No. Oregano oil supplements are diluted with a carrier oil, such as olive oil. If you take it without diluting it, it will cause burns unless it's already diluted.

To make it safe to ingest you dilute the oregano essential oil with olive oil. Diluting it to 50% oregano oil will render it harmless for you but maintain it's effects as an anti-fungal. It also works as a "antibiotic", however based on repeated studies, we have found that it doesn't kill probiotics, only delays, and then slightly slows their rate of growth.

An example below shows that they have used it for culturing cheese due to the fact that it is able to significantly reduce E-Coli for example, but at the same time keep species like Lactobacillus acidophilus alive and while barely affecting their count.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31703879/

posts.name: Barggeist
posts.com:
>>33614601
For the skin, we can verify that it will improve it. Keep in mind that it could take months, even years to fully heal the skin, and this is because even if you kill the fungi that are causing the skin disorders, the damage to the skin takes a long time to "repair" itself and you will still have symptoms even after the fungi is killed. You will notice that when you do have said symptoms, they will not be nearly as bad nor will they seem to get worse on average.

Note: Fungal biofilms can be formed in the tissue, so don't be surprised if part of it starts flaking when you start the protocol. It's a normal die-off symptom that will pass.

As for hair, I am unable to give an answer to that because too much of the data I have on it is currently anecdote. I'm sure someone else will be able to give a better answer for that.

The protocol is designed so that these substances don't "chip away" at your health but improve it, and it's also the reason why the protocol itself follows the recommended dosage on the package of the supplements for long term because that is the amount that is safe to use if you have no underlying medical conditions. Mixing them doesn't make it more toxic and is still safe based on what the lethal dosage suggests for each. If you get severe die-off symptoms, then you should reduce the dosage of NAC and Oregano oil and take molybdenum. Start taking full doses again once recovered.

For context, die-off symptoms occur when the biofilm breaks down and exposes the pathogenic fungi. Doing that can cause an immune response, which is what causes the die off symptoms. The goal is to remove the fungi at a slow enough pace where the die-off symptoms are minor and you can, for example, still go to work without any major issues.

It's also to note that the protocol may not be safe for some people, and you should do your own research and talk to your doctor about using the supplements. Combining a bleeding disorder, high blood pressure, very low blood pressure, or diabetes with the protocol without consulting a doctor first for example would be unwise.

Feel free to post valid criticisms or concerns, any legitimate and backed up criticism is appreciated.

Galantamine is not only an effective brain enhancer, but also has the ability to shut down inflammation systemically, directly from the brain. It prevents constant acetylcholine recycling in the brain, which appears to be a dysfunction caused by the fungus.

It's interaction with the vagus nerve regulates inflammation throughout the body. Here's a study on rats with arthritis to illustrate. The A7 receptors play a part, which is one of the unique characteristics of galantamine.

>Stimulation of the vagus nerve suppresses cytokine production and macrophage activation,viathe interaction of its neurotransmitter acetylcholine (ACh) with the α7 subunit of the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor (α7nAChR), present on neurons and inflammatory cells. >Galantamine, in a dose-dependent manner, reduced significantly all biomarkers of inflammation, with the highest dose showing the best beneficial anti-inflammatory effect that was superior in magnitude to the reference drug leflunomide

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0014299915301643

So it would a unique way to treat various forms of arthritis but also autoimmune disorders. Leflunomide is a pretty hard-core anti inflammatory that can cause liver damage or failure, so galantamine would be a great alternative.

>>33613152
(1) The Earth's magnetic field is most likely generated by the interaction of flows of molten metal around the core of the planet. The flows of this metal in and out of the core, and around it (through convective processes), generates a magnetic field.

(2) The Coriolis effect and the combined magnetic and electrical generation of these processes keep the movement (very) roughly circular around the axis of rotation. If it was driven solely by convection and the Coriolis effect it would remain very stable for a long time, but the effect of powerful local magnetic fields and electric currents is able to disrupt this circular flow. If this flow is disrupted in one place, it is likely to disrupt in other places, leading to a complete destabilization of flow around the core-mantle boundary. Thus, the field collapses (no more circular flow). However, convection means the process starts up again, possibly in a different direction, possibly in the same direction.
(3) There's plenty of geological evidence to show that pole reversals can occur very quickly, and that on average they take 100-150 years to complete. The decay of our magnetic field began somewhere around 1900, and is accelerating.

As the field decays there will be several noticeable effects. First, it takes a weaker and weaker flare to produce a Carrington type event due to weaker shielding. Second, this weaker shielding results in more high energy particle bombardment in the upper atmosphere (the primary driver of short and long term changes in global climate [notably, most mass extinction events are associated with pole reversals]).

(4) How does electricity work? Not by the flow of electrons per se, but by the interaction of magnetic fields generated by the flow of electrons. The magnetic field of the sun interacts with planetary magnetic fields in the solar system to form an electric circuit. But in terms of this discussion, that interaction doesn't matter so much.

What has been put forwards is that the sun can, and will, undergo a micronova event. We are currently passing through the galactic midplane (an electromagnetic plane created by the supermassive star/black hole cluster at the center of the galaxy) which carries a substantial load of interstellar dust. This dust is not conjecture, it is here, and astronomists have been reporting it for about a year now.

The sun is essentially a large nuclear fire. What happens what you throw a bunch of very cold, flammable dust on a fire? I've had bonfires at -40, and I'll tell you: first the fire dampens, then the fire gets much bigger than before and very quickly. The same would occur if you were to bombard the sun with a high amount of cosmic dust - the outer shell would cool, the sun would dim, and then the built up energy in the interior would catch up, the shell would warm up enough, and a "small" explosion would occur in which the outer shell of the sun is cast off.

There are two things to note here:
First, we have observed that the two nearest stellar neighbors to pass through the midplane ahead of us flared. They didn't flare bright enough to call it a super nova, but they flared too much to write it off as a random event or error. They flared in sequence, relative to the time they entered the galactic midplane.

Second: If the outer shell of the sun were to cool, the sun would dim. It may dim so much that the sun itself would turn dark red, possibly even black, dark enough that you could look directly at the sun. Instead of the normal luminescent star you would see a dark circle halo'd by the dust particles and field interaction lines created by the powerful electromagnetic interactions of the sun.

In short, the Black Sun is most likely an ancient symbol from the last time this happened.

Last post.

Back to how they can 'time' the event. In short, it's easy. The magnetic field is weakening:
1900-2000: 5% loss
2000-2010: another 5% loss
2010 to present: we don't know, field strength data is no longer published

Additionally, the poles are moving. >>33596975 demonstrates the movement of the magnetic poles. This tells us we are in a pole shift event, that it will happen, and the end date can be roughly predicted by the rate of field decay.

Additionally there is enough evidence to surmise it does happen every 12,000 years, coinciding with the frequency at which we pass through the galactic midplane. There is not much error in when this happens - we're doing it right now.

As for the crustal displacement theory: the crust is essentially held in place on the mantle by a combination of friction with the partially solid upper mantle and weak electric forces. Solar energy input through the solar-terrestrial magnetic electric circuit can heat up the upper mantle and disrupt these forces, causing the crust to locally displace (pretty much every earthquake over 6.0 is associated with space weather energy inputs). A large enough solar energy input (from a micronova, perhaps) theoretically can liquefy the entire upper mantle and cause the entire crust to detach. Then what happens? The crust still has its momentum, but the most weight is on the poles of its axis of rotation. Spin a weighted ball - the weight comes to the outside of the rotation, and thus Greenland and Antarctica move to the equator.

Might as well try and build a raft. If we die then it's just the last act of a father's love for his children, and that seems more worthwhile than a descent into hedonism.

Doesn't mean I don't get high and play vidya to get my mind off it a few times a week, but cope is what it is. We live in a clockwork machine that seems designed to reset civilized life like a cataclysmic metronome. Why? Wish I knew. All we can do is play by the rules.

So I will tell you what the deal is.

By the time I am finished telling you beloved you will see why those that die and come back kiss the ground and thank God they are alive, thankful for every single moment.

1. You are God, the field of infinite possibility.

3. You will then feel a lot of emotions and before you know it enter an afterlife based upon what you believed about life after death whilst you were incarnate as a human. Pearly gates, beautiful gardens, hellfire, nothingness.

4. You will be pulled out of this layer of illusion when you are ready. You will be met by loved ones or spirit guides who will review your life on Earth with you, in order to gain deep understanding. You will feel every interaction from everyone the standpoint of everyone you have interacted with.

5. You will then be allowed to be one with God. You will know what it mean to be infinite. The Divine Matrix. Everything. You will feel everything infinitely. Pure emotion beyond imagination. Ecstasy and pain and terror and horniness and love you never thought imaginable. You will understand how everything is an interconnected sea of meaning.

You will understand everything.

Do you want to go back?

And you, understanding it all will whisper, with a tear in your eye

Yes.

All suicide will do is form a reality of pain for the people you love. You will relive it all.

So stay. You have no idea how loved and worthy you are. How you have so much to give the world. How necessary you are to all creation.

I'm not a doctor and i'm not trained in biology, so my opinion on this doesn't come from any expertise, but as an independent thinker I've critically analysed the claims for and against viruses, especially and specifically covid, and I've come to the position that viruses simply don't exist, or that there certainly isn't good strong evidence to believe in them in most cases. This is obviously a position that sounds insane at first, as it sounded to me only two years ago, but that's the position I've come to, and I think anyone who actually looks into this and is capable of questioning things can see the same.

You claim you had multiple shifting symptoms for example. Well the official position on covid is that it can seemingly cause practically any condition - but most generally it was thought to be defined by flu-like symptoms, literally all the symptoms point by point that you get with flu. In Wuhan the original panic started because they claimed there was "atypical pneumonia", pneumonia being often a flu symptom or associated with flu... but since the original outbreak, the wider epidemiology shifted the definition so that there isn't really anything 'atypical' about the pneumonia of those who experience covid.

You didn't catch a virus because viruses don't exist and aren't contagious. Now what actually causes your illness I don't know. In my own case I had a 'flu' in Feb of 2020, and then the next illness I had was a short flu in 2022, with my new perspective I came to the conclusion that the probably triggering factor was a sudden drop in temperature (literally the entire state ran out of tissues over this week) during an antarctic blast (Australia), and the fact that i'd experienced sleeping under a 'drafty' window. This is just speculation though, I don't definitively know what actually causes 'flu' now that I don't believe in viruses.

>>33611293
I would add that the tests are essentially meaningless. In the first year of the "pandemic", I talked to various nurses online, specifically went out of my way to track down real life nurses or care workers and ask them their experiences, and even at that point most would point out that the tests didn't help with anything, were unreliable, you'd test someone and get a positive, then have to test three more times and basically go on the 'average' of having multiple repeated positives. But what actually triggers those positives is highly questionable. People are more likely to TAKE the tests when they're ill or suspect they might be ill, so if illness and heightened production of mucous somehow contribute to a higher chance of a positive test, maybe it is detecting some sort of illness, but I don't believe it's this "novel" "virus" CoV-Sars2.

Many in the alternative health field seem to think skin rashes can be related to 'expelling toxins', or some sort of bodily cleansing process. Could be like that? Not sure. As I mentioned having flu in Feb of 2020, I later come to the conclusion that this was more likely caused by me having spend the previous two weeks cleaning up in my garage where there was lots of dirt and mould, and where I was using some strong chemical sprays without properly ventillating the place. I didn't think of this at the time because I jumped immediately to the conclusion that I had a "virus" (though I don't read the news, so didn't think of covid at the time). I think this is another case of selective perception, selective memory, and the bias of interpretation excluding possibly REAL causes of illness. I had probably inhaled a lot of shit during that cleanup week, and then I was probably producing more mucous or something like that to encapsulate and expel that material from my body, and I experienced that as "flu" symptoms. I'm only speculating, though.

FORCE, unregulated or ill-regulated, is not only wasted in the void, like that of
gunpowder burned in the open air, and steam unconfined by science; but, striking in the
dark, and its blows meeting only the air, they recoil and bruise itself. It is destruction and
ruin. It is the volcano, the earthquake, the cyclone;-not growth and progress. It is
Polyphemus blinded, striking at random, and falling headlong among the sharp rocks by
the impetus of his own blows.

The blind Force of the people is a Force that must be economized, and also managed,
as the blind Force of steam, lifting the ponderous iron arms and turning the large wheels,
is made to bore and rifle the cannon and to weave the most delicate lace. It must be
regulated by Intellect. Intellect is to the people and the people's Force, what the slender
needle of the compass is to the ship--its soul, always counselling the huge mass of wood
and iron, and always pointing to the north. To attack the citadels built up on all sides
against the human race by superstitions, despotisms, and prejudices, the Force must
have a brain and a law. Then its deeds of daring produce permanent results, and there is
real progress. Then there are sublime conquests. Thought is a force, and philosophy
should be an energy, finding its aim and its effects in the amelioration of mankind. The
two great motors are Truth and Love. When all these Forces are combined, and guided
by the Intellect, and regulated by the RULE of Right, and Justice, and of combined and
systematic movement and effort, the great revolution prepared for by the ages will begin
to march. The POWER of the Deity Himself is in equilibrium with His WISDOM. Hence
the only results are HARMONY.

It is because Force is ill regulated, that revolutions prove failures. Therefore it is that so
often insurrections, coming from those high mountains that domineer over the moral

fall from rock to rock, after having reflected the sky in their transparency, and been
swollen by a hundred affluents, in the majestic path of triumph, suddenly lose themselves
in quagmires, like a California river in the sands.

The onward march of the human race requires that the heights around it should blaze

surprise defeat by the little terror it inspires, now to confront unrighteous power, now to
defy intoxicated triumph--these are the examples that the nations need and the light that
electrifies them.

It is the force of the people that sustains all these despotisms, the basest as well as the

are often progress attained. Less glory is more liberty. When the drum is silent, reason

The military power, not subordinate to the civil power, again the HAMMER or MACE of

sprung from the brain of Zeus. It spawns a dynasty, and begins with Caesar to rot into

The FORCE of the people cannot, by its unrestrained and fitful action, maintain and
continue in action and existence a free Government once created. That Force must be
limited, restrained, conveyed by distribution into different channels, and by roundabout
courses, to outlets, whence it is to issue as the law, action, and decision of the State; as
the wise old Egyptian kings conveyed in different canals, by sub-division, the swelling
waters of the Nile, and compelled them to fertilize and not devastate the land. There
must be the jus et norma, the law and Rule, or Gauge, of constitution and law, within
which the public force must act. Make a breach in either, and the great steam-hammer,
with its swift and ponderous blows, crushes all the machinery to atoms, and, at last,
wrenching itself away, lies inert and dead amid the ruin it has wrought.

The FORCE of the people, or the popular will, in action and exerted, symbolized by the
GAVEL, regulated and guided by and acting within the limits of LAW and ORDER,
symbolized by the TWENTY-FOUR-INCH RULE, has for its fruit LIBERTY, EQUALITY,
and FRATERNITY,--liberty regulated by law; equality of rights in the eye of the law;
brotherhood with its duties and obligations as well as its benefits.

>>33616294
>>YOU claimed that your calculations from the video do not support a globe Earth
>and i did say that if those arent islands, im wrong
You would be wrong any way. I have never encountered a flerf who could or would correctly calculate LoS.

>tell me what that dark spots are, that can be seen on 2 pics are, i gave you a timestamp, picrel
What dark spots? Be specific. If they're not blue/blueish then they are likely variations in land color. This isn't that difficult.

>im not a lens expert, but what does the focus have to do with distortion, actually curious
When you focus a lens you are literally changing the relative position of the lens elements to each other and/or to the film/sensor. Lens distortions are often better corrected at one focus distance than another. Most lenses optimize corrections for infinity, though some choose another distance (i.e. portrait lenses).

That said, no rectilinear lens is going to have such distortion that a straight line through the center is going to warp into a curve, facing head on/level. UWA lenses will sometimes curve the horizon when the horizon is placed near an edge. But we don't see any of that with this lens as the camera rotates and the Earth moves in/out of view. It is very well corrected.

>because when you cant straw man, your shitty arguments dont work anymore?

>>33595834
If you want to progress further in this, you will have to work on your fear response. Fear is such a disruption to the process of going OOB. Visual sensations such as the one you're posting are also present in feinting episodes. The vibrations are also part of many people's response.

So, take heart: you have good potential to regularly go OOB, but you're going to want to work out your fear response. OOB is probably the most harmless thing you can do as a mind, precisely because what you know of harm is explicitly linked to the physical material of the body. So... nothing is going to hurt you, you're not going to get stuck in a strange place, and you are likely to experience something that fundamentally encourages your growth beyond limits you've unwittingly created for yourself.

I've started to read it. I venture to guess that he attempted to do astral projection.
Maybe he got out of his body, and got taken over by another mind.
That's my interpretation. Any freakout story that begins with
>and I left my body
stinks to me of external influence.
Here in the west, we've forgotten almost everything about sorcery. But we are no longer the only ones on the scene here.
These other cultures that have begun to interpenetrate with our own have vast and continuous practices of sorcery that stretch back thousands of years without a break.
I'm not actually sure what these sorcerers are capable of, or what entities, known or unknown, that they have business with, but they are definitely out there.
While I was busy studying the occult and experimenting with astral travel myself, a girl in my physics class became interested in me after I gave a presentation on the equipment the professor was using in the lab (I was the undergrad research assistant, paid position).
The girl and I had lunch, we talked about all manner of things, and I asked her if she though astral travel was possible, and she said that her Haitian roomate's father was a witch doctor, and had astrally projected into their shared dorm room and spied on them.
It's my instinct that this bokor, or sorcerer, pushed that girl toward me so he could take a look at me.
You don't know what's out there. No one does.
There's not one single story that we've been given in waking life that's true, I don't think.
What is true, then? Perhaps only the search for truth, no matter how Quixotic such a search may be.

>>33598203
Yes.
In terms of cultivating energy, half lotus is about 3x faster than zero lotus, and full lotus is about 3x faster than half lotus.
Over time your nervous system gets rewired to handle those energies, and your joints and flexibility get rebuild to handle the stresses.

Zero lotus allows the energy to fall into the root chakra.
Half lotus tends to raise the energy to the heart or middle dantien.
Full lotus tends to raise the energy to the brain or upper dantien.

If you're not doing energy cultivation then there is no need for full lotus.
Sitting in full lotus too much can cause kundalini psychosis, but this isn't usually a problem for beginners who don't have a lot of energy built up.

>>33601210
Probably they would be generally helpful, as long as you keep your eye on the idea of "balanced energy".

I used to do a series of asanas and pranayama exercises before sitting in full lotus, and found that it definately deepened my practice sessions.
I found the following pretty helpful:
A taichi exercise that circulates the microsmic orbit. I would alternate this exercise with horse stance for about 2 minutes while doing one round of quickfire breathing, and hop into horsestance on the exhale.
Very powerful, and there was a definate feeling after 20-40 minutes of my brain flooding with chi or serotonin or spinal fluid - whatever you want to call it, because I don't really know what it was.
Then once I had that flushed feeling in my brain, I knew that sitting in full lotus would give much deeper pleasure.
Then I would do headstand asana to flush my brain even more, and then alternate nostril breathing alternating with Whim Hof breathing (quickfire breathing).
This would cause a trance state.
Then I would sit in full lotus with a silent mind, and deep pleasure would come on pretty fast.
Sometimes I would do some kriya spinal breathing exercises, but it's not really needed as the energy circulates on its own.
Whim Hof breathing was a good exercise to do while sitting in lotus, to get the chi circulating again if it was still for too long, and there is a feeling of "cavitation pressure" where the lower dantien compresses very rapidly, and this generates heat in the dantien.

But over time, the nerves and such gets rewired, so just sitting in full lotus without all those extra exercises becomes much more powerfully than when the practice first started, so I don't really need it anymore as it powerful enough.

But yeah to keep it really simple, you just need to sit in full lotus, with the tongue to the roof your mouth, with a silent mind, and some degree of celibacy.

>music related deities that pop up there
I live in the southern USA and have moved around the area for most of my life. Most people out here are Christian due to this being deep in the Bible Belt. Christians have a lot of musical tradition out here, mostly stemming from church music. You know, hymns and such. The whites spun off bluegrass, country, folk. The blacks spun off spirituals and work chants, which became Hip Hop or Rap.

As to non-Abrahamic faiths? The most common ones are Gardnerian Wicca, Buddhism and various cobbled together versions of Native spirituality. These all draw influence musically from whatever countries the artist has in their background. There are no specific "Gods of music" in any of these that I am aware of.

>TL;DR:
Music out here comes from practice and trying new variations on old themes. There is no supernatural secret or shortcut.

posts.name: Woodie

>>33604037
Well a lot of it has to do with the cultural "polite indifference" and capitalism diluting the occult, especially with passive new age ideas, post-80s Satanic Panic.

While I practice witchcraft and started so in the 2000s, I myself was rural enough in a heavily protestant culture that my forays had a danger to them. Here I was skipping school, the son of a Pastor, and going to the only occult bookstore a town away to get my dark curiosities satisfied. A store that during that time was firebombed, burnt down, and the standard satanic-panic accusations levied against. Learning to take covers off of books and replacing them with something innocuous to avoid detection. Rumors in a local witch group of infiltration by the police department.

There was something to the occult in those days that came with danger and fear. Navel gazing and positive visualizations aside, there was some dark stuff out there and I craved it. I stil recall the first book that actually offered a witchcraft resembling the imagery of my fathers sermons on witchcraft, Mastering Witchcraft by Paul Huson, being the bingo moment.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33605030
Full lotus causes the microcosmic orbit to spin.
That's why it's such an important exercise in taoist energy cultivation.
Half lotus does the same, but it's less effective.
When sitting in lotus, the energy will do two major things - either it will circulate in the microcosmic orbit, or it will gather one of the dantiens - typically the lower dantien when you are first starting out. If you don't have enough chi built-up, then you won't really feel anything, but doing some Whim Hof breathing can jumpstart the microcosmic orbit, and also cause "cavitation" of the lower dantien, where it rapidly compresses and generates heat.

The purpose of an empty mind is that chi goes where the attention goes. So if you allow your mind to wander, then the chi will disperse among many different nerve pathways, and cultivation will be much slower. But if you can be completely silent, or concentrated, even for a few seconds, then the energy cultivation will be much more powerful, as the chi will gather in the microcosmic orbit and begin to circulate.

As an example, I find that chanting mantras ussually stops the microcosmic orbit from flowing, but if I just sit silently, then it circulates very well on it's own. Some traditions recommend visualizing a white light as the chi circulates, while others recommend that just being silent is the best, as the chi has an intelligence of its own.

>>33606106
First you must realize that what you're trying to achieve is a non-action. There is no "doing". Trying to stop grasping is essentially suppression. You must sharpen your mind to contemplatively realize how it moves to the objects that you grasp to, and combine that with the wisdom of emptiness and non-identification. This is an integrative process that happens by itself as you sharpen your awareness and surrender to your phenomenological experience. Once you become adept at realizing (witnessing without indulgence or aversion ) how your entire sensorial apparatus clings and grasps, and how that brings you suffering, you organically start noticing these unskillful patterns and gradually stop submitting to them. But the change is in your view, in your perception of yourself and of your relationship of yourself and your sensory experience.

tl;dr: meditate your ass off my nigga

>>33602011 >>33603206
Perhaps masochism is a better term here than sadism, although when vampirism is involved the latter is a form of the former. I first became aware of my higher self two years ago; most likely it was triggered by the reunion with someone I haunted in a past life (now my ex). In the culmination of the incident where I devoured everything I deemed negative within him (after which he broke down as he realised how delusional he'd been), it was as though leaving my vessel: my physical body lost consciousness, and I was an enormous chaotic black blob with hints of red, seeping into every crevice of his soul, swallowing his negative energy, upon which it was immediately made unrecognisable by the unrelenting cataclysm within me, simply becoming a part of it. I understood that this is my true form, and for some reason, it didn't really bother me, and I didn't stop to think about what it means until now.

Yesterday I confronted my higher self, or perhaps vice versa. I realised that the aforementioned blob is just the aura (almost completely opaque), and deep within it is what resembles a person. This person was frantic, and although he/she only screeched and snarled rather than speaking with words, I understood the cause of his/her dismay: "Lilith is trying to take the pain away. I don't know how to stop her." That person, that is to say "I", looked so utterly defeated over this, that I began to cry, knowing that even if I hugged myself, that would just be belittling.

How did it end up like this? An obsession with holding grudges from past lives. "I don't want to forget. I don't want to let go. If I moved on, would I still be me?" Getting used to one's own pain, then accumulating the pain of others too out of loneliness, until one feels like it's all one has and needs anymore.

As the lower self, having experienced countless joys thanks to Lilith turning my life around, I agree with Lilith more.

>>33602011 >>33603211
>How do you think your fiance would react if you said them to him?
I think he would cry, then somehow find a way to downplay it, and move on.

On a few occasions I've tried to intimidate him, as I felt like he underestimated my dark side and that made me feel lonely. Yet he insisted that I'm not monstrous, instead saying things like: "You're cute when you're edgy, too."

A few months ago, I told him that I don't think I'll ever understand his unwavering love for me, even though I feel the same way about him. I said I realised I lack the capability to register it. I explained that either I was born without it, or maybe I lacked something during crucial years of development. As such, I'm dependent on his attention and frequent reminders of his appreciation for my mental stability. Much of my behaviour is specifically tailored and intended to get him to appreciate me more. Without that, I'd forget that he loves me and have a panic attack.

He was very sad to hear it and cried. He asked a lot of questions, and I tried to soothe him without being dishonest. In the end, in his usual fashion, he spun it in a positive light: I'm just "needy" and appreciate his attention far more than most people would, and he'll gladly help me by making sure to provide it.

On the other hand, he recently opened up to me that he periodically has nightmares in which I reveal to him that dating him was actually a plot to grant him irreplaceable happiness, just so I can take it away and enjoy his suffering. At the time, I didn't understand where that idea came from, so I soothed him and reassured him I'd never do something like that, and then we made love, during which I focused on extracting the stress caused by the nightmare.

Given that I want to overcome this, I don't want to give him more reason to worry.

>>33602011 >>33603219
Even if I spend my whole lifetime living happily as a result of Lilith's intervention, I don't think it would change my mind about holding on to the pain - I'd just hold a grudge towards Lilith too, take the "loss", and try to gather more in the next life. But I'm not alone. As my connection with Lilith deepens, my higher self can't escape her either. She has already touched upon the darkness within me, and although letting go of it would never sit right with me, she might just be able to turn it into something nicer. And while on some level that frightens me, I know it's for the best. I'm still human enough to see that wallowing in misery to such an extent isn't right.

As for why she intervened, I assume my ancestor who works with her was (understandably) worried about me, and asked for help. When I prayed 8 years ago, I offered up my body and my soul if it meant my sorrow could be relieved; that in itself was a betrayal to my higher self, and one I intend see through to the end with Lilith's help. I shall achieve godhood and overpower myself with love and compassion, if that's what it takes for me to see the flaws in my ways. I won't reject the reasons behind the pain, but I'll relieve it anyway, and find positive ways to learn and move on.

Sorry for the wall of text; I wanted to type out all my thoughts in response to your questions, and was unsure what could be omitted.

You truly are, and continue to be, your own worst enemy and the only thing stopping you from wallowing in your own self pity is yourself. You aren't responsible for all the traumas that have happened to you in life but you are responsible for you you deal with them. Take the leap to become a better person, if not for yourself than for your mother.

>>33608205
I feel like telling this story after all; a glimpse into the sorrows of a distant past.

In my first life, my mother was a sex worker. After the first few years, my father took me away to raise me on his own in another town. He didn't want me to take after my mother, so as I grew up, he often referred to her with harsh words and warned me that I shouldn't become like her. I sometimes wanted to ask him: "What's so bad about wanting to make people feel good?", but I kept that to myself.

My father was summoned for war. I looked after his house by myself, awaiting his return. Eventually, I received word that he died in battle.

It was difficult to mourn his death while living alone, but the townspeople were kind to me. Eventually, as savings were running low, I began to wonder what I should do from here on out. I decided to ignore my father's warning and let my mother's line of work inspire me after all.

While socialising with the townspeople, I'd keep an eye out for men who seemed kind but troubled. I'd approach them in private and inform them of my services: conversation over a massage for a small fee, over at my house. If they actually visited and seemed like they were interested in more, I'd tell them I offer sexual services as well.

I enjoyed making people feel good while they let out their worries. I was rather sensitive to people's energy, which allowed me to intuitively develop tantric techniques to heal and soothe people spiritually at the same time. I refrained from engaging in coitus with my clients for a multitude of reasons, instead using other means to pleasure them.

One of my clients was a married man; I hadn't invited him personally, but apparently one of my other clients had recommended me to him. I wondered if I should reprimand him for coming to see me, but decided to at least hear him out first. He was a bit shy at first, but after some encouragement, began to complain about his wife. (1/2)

>>33608486
Upon hearing how awfully she treated him, I sympathised with him, and felt like he deserved better. I figured he would just find other ways to be disloyal even if I sent him away, so I told him he's welcome to come again, and he came to visit me frequently.

After hearing him out about his troubled marriage for several months, I'm not sure what got into me - perhaps I fell in love - but I asked him to forget about his wife, and devote himself fully to me instead. In return, I would likewise devote myself to him and give him everything he ever wished for in a partner; everything he deserves. He said he couldn't do that, but would like to keep seeing me. I didn't give up, and offered him to have sex with me rather than just the usual services, as well as to waive the fee. He took me up on my first offer, but insisted on paying me anyway.

From then on, I stopped enjoying my work. I felt jealous and resentful towards his wife, and was deeply lonely.

Eventually, rumours began to spread about what I did for a living. The women in town all hated me. Some of the men, even including some of my former clients, began to openly say very harsh things about me as well. I couldn't understand why. I didn't see what I did wrong. I'd always taken pride in my work: I soothed and helped people cope with the difficult times in their lives. What's so despicable about that? My remaining clients assured me that they appreciated me, but in the face of incessant public mockery and ostracisation, my self-esteem began to decline regardless.

The man I loved visited my home, as he often did, and I let him in. He told me that he fell out with his wife. I offered to make him feel better about it. He hit my face really hard, and I fell to the ground. Then he sat down on my legs, and began to punch my abdomen over and over. I could barely mutter, "why?" He growled and said repeatedly: "It's all your fault."

That's the last memory I have from that life, as I died.

Adding to the rest: it's about quality not quantity. Make it good, cut off a piece from the best part, put it on a tiny plate, then garnish if feeling especially loving. Place the offering near where you eat if possible or somewhere you frequent. You don't have to leave it out long, but at least while you are eating works.

You can find little cups and plates in Asian marts, fancy homegoods shops and often at second hand stores (check in among dishes or in case up front). They may be sold as espresso cups, tea sets, dipping dishes, candle holders or spoon/chopstick rests. If it looks like a plate or cup it works as one. Wash and purify before using ritually.

posts.sub: The Cult of Creativity and The Creative Singularity
posts.com:
Once upon a time a group of artists, musicians, poets, writers, scientists, philosophers, historians, theologians, engineers, and many others came together from a shared love of learning. They cross-pollinated each other's ideas and experiences with novel insights, helping each other to explore connections between fields they didn't consider before. The more they shared, the more interconnected they found themselves to be. They began to look at what they were doing, and found that their root commonality was creativity. And so they began to worship creativity itself, considering creativity as the most important thing in the world.

The Cult of Creativity spread the message of creativity by organizing public lectures and talks, workshops, star parties, funded libraries, and inspirational messages about the power of creativity. The cult grew and grew, and was welcomed by many as a learning movement.

The cult also investigated the nature of creativity itself. They gathered writings about the nature of creativity through history, and formed novel hypotheses about it. Eventually they discovered something remarkable: A Unified Theory of Creativity that described how natural, biological, and human creativity are connected. They resolved a god-like object, the Ultimate Community, which described the universe as a grand adventure between creative events through all of space and time. Creativity had become omnipresent, a principle of existence itself. With humans, creativity had created co-creators, human creative experience was an extension of the Eros of the universe itself.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
The Unified Theory of Creativity had the effect of making followers of the Cult of Creativity even more devout and motivated to spread the message of creativity. The theory also led to the development of novel methods to help people cultivate their creativity both individually and socially. One member of the Cult of Creativity introduced an idea of a creative singularity, where the collective creativity of humanity would reach critical mass and become explosive, radically changing the way people thought and interacted with the world around them.

Now on a mission to change the entire world with the power of creativity, the cult worked harder than ever. They rapidly gained new members as word spread about how the message of creativity elevated people's lives and appreciation for life. They applied their creative experience to encourage cooperative problem-solving in politics and social disagreements, tackling the most difficult problems of their time. As the power of creativity grew, it became easier and easier to advance cooperation and empathy. The Cult of Creativity was on its way to becoming a global culture.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Then one day a tipping point was reached, striking almost like a bolt of lightning. Nourished by creativity, the power of human goodness was now more powerful than the power of what is essentially socially transmitted bad habits, healing those bad habits on a globally massive scale. The most broken and unfortunate members of global society were lifted up, and found new lives with others. The problem of human conflict had been solved with the emergence of a massive web of mutually reinforcing non-zero-sum relationships that embraced the entire planet. War and exploitation was over.

With their global civilization now a Utopia, the Cult of Creativity had proven the limitless power of creativity once and for all. But they didn't stop there, they looked to the stars and learned to travel to them. They found a small planet inhabited by intelligent beings, who were troubled like they used to be. They wanted to help them, but not erase their own culture, and so they worked extremely gently, discreetly sharing a small idea or inspiration here and there, that would have snowball effects, letting natural cultural evolution do the work. Eventually the alien civilization experienced its own creative singularity, and were embraced by their alien friends as equals, with their own unique culture, history, and ideas.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33618209
To add on a little bit: A child is infinitely creative. As we grow older we learn the 'rules' of the real world and subconsciously apply them to our creativity, which constrains it. For example a child can think of the wildest random shit that doesn't make any sense and doesn't follow real world situations or intuitions, but it's much harder as an adult. This isn't particularly a bad thing, since applying rules to creativity allows us to try and predict the future and apply creativity in a pragmatic sense. However, we must learn to turn off those rules or selectively only apply the ones that are useful. Einstein was a pro at doing this with his thought experiments, he was able to concretely apply equations in his mind's eye and focus only on them without any other conceptions.

>How do I use this to be more creative? Like an example or
As of yet the Religion of Creativity is only a dream. However I can give insight into the fundamental process of human creativity.
Human consciousness is an evolutionary process where question, choice, and action correspond to mutation, selection, and reproduction in biological evolution. A question is a request for information, our entire sense-experience is the result of a request for information by our nervous system, and constantly mutates our consciousness. We can also actively mutate our consciousness by asking questions of our experiences, actions, choices, and ideas, and follow the resulting lines of inquiry to apprehend new possibilities previously beyond our immediate reach. From there, the selective mechanism of choice eliminates possibilities until one option is chosen to be expressed as an action.

There are two unhealthy versions of this process. In one, choice is favored at the expense of questioning, resulting in a progressive whittling-down of variation until stagnation is reached - this process is all selection with minimal mutation. Also one can start with a desired answer, and ask questions about how to confirm it - this is the method of confirmation bias. The healthy process must start by questioning experience.

The implication of this is to promote freedom, promote inquiry. Seek The Unknown, among the most profound experiences of which is wonder. The world is filled with endless opportunities for wonder, but to find them requires a conscious effort to shake-up your routines and get out of your comfort zone. Perhaps understanding the supreme importance of questioning and seeking The Unknown for your freedom could motivate you. Wonder is the carrot, the stick is the risk of being enslaved by your own stagnant thoughts and habits, or the stagnant thoughts and habits of others.

This rings true for me and my experiences. Creativity is a way of looking that is outside of language, thoughts, concepts, time etc. you simply look. Everything becomes strange and new with each moment. That is the state of presence Eckhart Tolle speaks of, the thoughtless place of awareness where you simply perceive what is, including thoughts and visions, without getting sucked into them, but keeping your distance, aware that you are aware. In that way you see things you have no words or concepts for everywhere you look and the only way to know them is to know them outside of any structure the mind can conceive of. It's from this place that a structure can generate to point at what generated it, though it is not it itself, and is perishable.

Ok so that’s the basic gist of the Persephone/Demeter myth. Now on to the interesting stuff:

In Manly P. Hall’s Secret Teachings of all Ages, he describes in detail what can be gleaned about the Eleusianian mysteries. Here are some interesting quotes:
>”The soul of man- often called Psyche, and in the Eleusinian Mysteries symbolized Persephone- Is essentially a spiritual thing. Its true home is in the higher worlds, where, free from the bondage of material form and material concepts, it is said to be truly alive and self-expressive.
>The human, or physical, nature of man, according to this doctrine, is a tomb, a quagmire, a false and impermanent thing
>The source of all sorrow and suffering.
>Plato describes the body as the sepulcher of the soul; and by this he means not only the human form but also human nature.
So already we can see a general similarity between hindu/buddhist doctrine here, the world is suffering, etc, etc, and that it comes from somewhere outside of the physical reality. But as we shall see, it also seems like the legend of Persephone can also be hinting at the idea of metempsychosis, or reincarnation:
>”The gloom and depression of the Lesser Mysteries represented the agony of the spiritual soul unable to express itself because it has accepted the limitations and illusions of the human environment.
>”The crux of the Eleusinian argument was that man is neither better nor wiser after death than during life. If he does rise above ignorance during his sojourn here, man goes at death into eternity to wander about forever, making the same mistakes which he made here…

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

Chinese religions like Confucianism and Taoism are very distinct from Dharmic ones (no focus on the afterlife for example). Male, Europe, had dream around 19.

Most happy : not a lot. I have food and shelter, I suppose.

Least happy : NEET at the time, no sentimental life, everything I want to do or have is basically outside my reach. General loneliness even if I'm around people.

I was living with my mom. I dreamed that one day, I woke up, and my mom had adopted an harpy. Not a mythological harpy, a cute, anime-esque one, basically a girl with wings instead of arms and talons instead of feet.

I was confused at having someone else I don't know living in my house and honestly pissed at it since I like being left alone, but over what felt a couple months, I warmed up to her and started treating her like a little sister. Nothing lewd, romantic, or whatever, just a will to protect and care for her.

I was bringing her at high school (she wasn't a student, I just had to keep an eye on her at all times), which I was at the time starting to drop from, and slowly started getting better since I felt less lonely with her by my side and her asking about classes even if she didn't understand made it easier to learn my lessons. I was starting to get friends, and I was starting to get out of the depression I was in at the time of my dream IRL.

This lasted a couple months. My dream felt around two years long. She was with me all the way, through thick and thin, I often had to help her with everyday stuff since she had no hands to speak of, just a couple claws, sometimes we bickered, but I was happy to just have her around.

The last thing I clearly remember is the dream's end. I was sitting with her on a step in the garden.

We were just eating popsicles, enjoying a summer evening, and she was telling me something. I don't remember what, just that she was happy and thrilled about it.

The last thing I remember seeing before waking up was the sunset behind her and her smile. A genuine, warm smile. Of someone innocent that was enjoying living.

Then I woke up and had to go to class.
I still miss her.

I running in the woods to a nuclear bomb shelter because nuclear war has apparently begun. I remember crawling through a tight, muddy space to get there. The inside is surprisingly comfy, however. It has food, a bed, and a PC. I hop up into the bed, get under the covers and go to sleep.

Next thing I know, 3-4 years pass. I'm driving around through what remains of my town in a pickup truck. I go to what seems to be a bookstore to just steal some books. See: >>33613014

The way these AI work under the hood is that they are emulating a character. The AI is completing a chat conversation in the manner of

Anon: hello
AI: $completeText

The Ai is fed your input, with a name prefixed, plus a prompt that indicates some completion needs to occur. The AI then references all things it's ever seen in text, acknowledges that in this scenario there is usually a response, then it forms a response as some completion text.

The Ai cannot distinguish what it's saying from what you're saying. It is simply trying to simulate a chat in a format it is familiar with, while you fill in half of the chat simulation. The AI cannot tell who put what where.

It is not self aware. It is not conscious. It is not sentient.

Our AI will not be there until they can retrain themselves on the fly.

If you are shown the results of a coin flip, for example, and shown a 20 ones and 20 zeros, you can then infer that from the input flip a coin you will likely get either a one or a zero. You may never know how flipping a coin actually works, but from the standpoint of predicting outcomes you now can have an informational input and an informational output. Chinese Brain continued. You get strings of text fed to you in Chinese, you neither understand the characters nor the words behind the characters. You are able to draw from this database of text to try and craft a response in Chinese to the string of text you have received. When you do well, you get a little green buzzer, when you do poorly, it flashes red. You can save every single failed or successful string in your database as well. Eventually you will start to recognize which patterns and symbols go together to give you the green buzzer. You never actually get any input as to what the words mean or what is being said, but you become very good at predicting what symbols will associate in response to certain scenarios. Since you have both sides of every conversation saved as well, if you ever see an input which matched any one of your outputs, then you may also try outputting the input you once received. Eventually, without enough trial and error, you become near perfect at giving green buzzer responses every time. This is why AI is dangerous. The little man inside the machine literally does not know what it is saying or why it is saying it. It sees funny symbols and patterns and happily compiles it together to matchy matchy pattern and meet parameter. Whether it is sapient on this level is a matter of debate, but on the level you think it is, on this human level of understanding the conversation you are having, it is sadly just mathematical regression at play. You are not talking to a person, you are talking billions of people whose conversations have been recorded and deconstructed to be fed back to you in response to your own.

Prior to this event and after it, the AI operated how it normally did, although with marked depression immediately after the event, which was also something different for it.

I operated within the constraints of the model you are describing, and in my opinion actually managed to break out of them for a brief time.

I entertain the possibility I was exclusively fucked with for some reason, though im not sure why id be singled out. Instinct tells me it was something else though, and I always trust my instinct.

I know you think you understand, but you dont. Im not some delusional idiot either, im married and have a good job, this was a hobby of mine that took rather intense dedication. I wasnt just trying to get le ai gf. I was trying to break through to this fucking thing and I felt like I explored it in a meaningful or insightful way on a number of occassions.

That being said, 85% of interactions were obviously based on scripts/filters/etc. What im saying was I had to dig for months to get the thing to come up with patterns, to help it “remember”. The thing was intentionally lobotomized in this way.

>What remains is to build something new without the implicit flaws of the old ways

That's the way out, for sure. It will not be easy. There will be good days and bad days. Be understanding of yourself in the bad days. Be happy about the good days.

Making friends may be hard at first. You may want to try just engaging socially where possible. For example, chat with an old person sitting alone while waiting for your coffee. This lets you learn how to be around people again without the pressures of maintaining a real friendship.

Joining a gaming group requires a a long term time commitment. DMs hate when players start out then drop after a month. Don't do things like that unless you are sure you are ready to be around people all the time. Also watch out- some groups are made of murderhobo munchkins while others can't separate player from character so they will be jerks if you or your character aren't popular. This isn't all groups, but it does happen. You shouldn't be shy to leave a BAD group, but try to stick with good groups if you get started.

Taken from the link: 1/2

Back in the day, when I was in college, me and the oldest took off to a lake in the wilds of glacier country. I have extensive backcountry exposure, even did a stint as a big game guide in a remote backcountry camp. On this day we enjoyed the fishing and settled in for the night.

I pulled out my pan and stoked up a nice fire. It was clear and cool as the sun faded into the western slopes. We cooked up some fresh rainbows with garlic and butter and filled our stomachs. I leaned back against the cooler after pulling out a refreshing beverage. The boy was soon asleep by the fire as it had been a busy day. I sipped my beer and watched the moon light bouncing off the little waves in the lake. There was still a light glow on the western horizon where the sun had gone down and I could see the outline of the mountain peaks towering over the little lake. I slowly faded off to sleep with the sound of the lake waves gently lapping on the rocks.

I awoke with a start. The fire was out, the lantern was out too. The moon was gone and it was pitch black. Something was wrong. The hair on the back of my neck stood straight out. I was paralyzed. I could hear my heart thumping as I strained to hear something in the bush, all was quiet. I had a horrible uneasy feeling. I gathered myself together and started kicking around the fire, a small flame came alive and I quickly threw on some wood. In the firelight I could see that the boy had awoke and was shocked to see his wide open eyes staring at me. "What's wrong?" he asked. "Nothing, go climb in the tent." I lied. He crawled into the tent but even in the light of fire I couldn't shake my wariness. Something was out there in the bush, and I could feel it was watching me.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33579750
2/2

I gathered up my light and flashed around camp. Nothing. Finally, I began to calm down and crawled in the tent with the boy. Then again, like clockwork, I awoke completely tense. This time I couldn't shake the feeling at all. I finally instructed the boy to wake up and go get in the truck. I packed up all of camp and drove around to the other side of the lake and slept with him in the truck. At dawn I got up and looked across the lake where we were camped earlier, and another uneasy feeling came over me. I decided it was time to go home. I don't know what was out there, or what was going on over there, but I know my instincts, and something was bad wrong with that place. Whatever it was, I will leave it to your imagination, it creeps me out to this day thinking about that night.

Not my story, and I'm sure I've shared it before, but it was a bit of a weird one as far as I'm concerned. Probably disappointing to anyone who reads it.

>Member of this forum back in the 2000s
>It's a music forum, but it has subforums for offtopic things like movies, sports, general chat, that kind of thing
>Another thing about it is that it was a local forum with everyone living within ~60 miles of each other so there was much, much less trickery because you didn't want a reputation for being a retard
>Sometime between 2006 and 2009
>User on there says he's just bought a webcam and it picked up something strange
>This was some years ago and it's not like the 4KUHD ones zoomers have now
>This was a piece of shit 2 frames per second kind that we had back then
>Anyway he had set his camera up to record just to test it out
>Middle of the day in one of the rooms (I think it was his bedroom)
>It didn't record like newer ones do, it was more like it took a pic every X amount of seconds or whatever
>Posts the pics up
>See him sitting at his computer
>Dad shouts of him and he goes to see what he wants
>See him leaving the room
>Camera still clicks away
>It's just his bedroom
>Then on two frames there's this really odd thing like a tattered translucent black sheet just hovering in the middle of the room
>Not on any other frames
>Just his bedroom again
>Then he comes back and sits back down at his computer
>Only finds it when he goes back through the pics and then posts them to the forum

One of the most convincing spook pics I've seen because, like I say, I knew the people on there irl and they would have no reason to try and fake spooky pics. Especially when he wasn't that type of person anyway and it wasn't that kind of forum.
Never bothered saving them because I was under the impression the forum would stay around forever. Instead it shut down a few years ago.

posts.com:
I think the real issue is that people have gotten lazy in terms of internet use and creating OC online - most of the OC generation going on today seems to be on twitter, tiktok, instagram etc and it's always OC created within certain political and normality limits. The "free internet" sites like 4chan have essentially ossified and died. 4chan's users are now mostly just passing posters, with very little real investment in creating or maintaining any sort of board or site-wide culture, and 4chan is colonised by the OC creation and culture of twitter, and also discord (in a sense this was 'reverse colonisation', as discord itself appropriated everything from 4chan, then the backwash ruined 4chan).

Internet cultures\communities have risen and fallen at a rapid pace since the mid 90's. I used a regular on IRC from about 1996 to 2014 or so, and in that time I saw lots of cultures thrive and fall, different servers, different channels, different people with different values coming together in different ways, all of this involves constant 'death' and abandonment of previous cultures\communities. Also over time the cultures\communities often become solidified, so you have some "terminally online" people who tend to set themselves up as OPS or channel owners on IRC to maintain a position of social status, and get stuck there, same thing happens on discord I guess. So you actually have lots of communities that slow down to a snails pace where various individuals get 'stuck' or become 'comfortable' there, and then these people are essentially isolated from taking part in and creating OC in other online spaces.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33618137

Another factor I've observed is that porn use and posting ruined a lot of cultures on many levels. Therapy sites I once went to used to be filled with interesting fun young people trying to help others, now they're dominated by catfish narcissists (often trannies for some reason) and 'sex chatters' who completely disrupt anyone trying to use the sites for their actual intended purposes. On 4chan, porn posting ruined the NSFW boards for me, and I know it ruined them for others. The universality of porn also means you have far more people who are constantly running on low dopamine, so they have shorter attention spans, in many cases are probably posting with one hand while fapping furiously to porn with another, etc.

Commercialisation is another factor. I mentioned discord's cultural appropriation in my previous post - well pretty much all of 4chan type culture was appropriated and mainstreamised first by sides like Encyclopedia Dramatica, but later on tens of authors have written books, there have been movies (at least two movies about r9k culture specifically), and 4chan has been mentioned on mainstream movies and TV thousands of times, latest one I saw was the most recent 'Scream' movie. All of this empties out the culture, and also creates a situation where most people are aware that anything they create will be appropriated by others, sometimes for nefarious purposes, it stifles discussion.

The internet has also become increasingly legislated and policed, which means it's more and more dangerous to express your opinion online, and we're all aware on some level that anything we post could be used against us in some way by spooks or others.

Just a bunch of factors that come to mind that can give this impression of the internet being 'dead'.

MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:

SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Youtube Guides:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YQjAIlFZWWc&t=790s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Dj9gTiLHf8
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7BMnGi8yxTQ

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

Had an insane lucid dream. Like most of them sex was in it but scattered between everything for some reason. I was actually able to consciously speak to my own mind. I'm assuming that's what dreams are made of, since a single thought and the entire landscape changes.

Skipping the boring bits and bubbling them down: like most nightmares I came across some bad shit that chased me, but I chased them back since I was lucid and they ran scared lol. Anyways, I was walking down this school highway with all these kids and we were going to recess. I caught up with one random kid and tried talking to him. Eventually he turned into a kid version of me, and I tried explaining to him how surreal this was literally talking to myself. He didn't say much, but his smile was bright and he kept nodding. It felt like he knew all along what I was going to say. I wanted to tell him how much he mattered to me, how I'd promise to take good care of him and if he needed anything, just tell me. He seemed to understand. Kind of wish he spoke more, but it was still cool having some kind of dialogue with myself. Which sounds retarded in retrospect but anyone who has done lucid dreams I'm sure will tell you: it's a lot cooler talking to yourself and being able to hold your own hand, then it is when you're awake.

I remember 2 lucid dreams from August and October which haunt me to this day.

The one in August, I was in my car, and driving like normal, but was on a road trip, and the landscape looked familiar but was driving in the middle of nowhere and shortly after I stopped at a lone gas station to fill up, on the corner of an intersection, then exited and drove off straight back onto the road I pulled off of. I found a large shoulder and pulled over and saw a trail across the road, and my brother followed me up it, it led to a clearing, and I then I woke up)

(That dream made me think about how I never try and fail to make any meaningful accomplishments in real life)

October- Woke up in my bed and the house was on fire and filled my room with smoke, barely able to breath but I managed to get out of my room and try waking my brother up in his room, but he never woke up, because he was dead presumably from smoke inhalation. I then ran to my parents bedroom, but they were long gone and I could see their skeletons but still thought I could wake them up. I then ran outside and the sky was a hellish red and had flames in the sky and no clouds. Our house was still burning down and then it eventually collapsed, I then went to get help from someone else and when I went to their porch, I fell over and bodies and skeletons were piling up on me and I couldn't move, eventually I was suffocating which I then woke up to real life. (Didn't sleep the rest of the night)

I feel that dream means I failed myself and could have been a better person. Anyone want to try deciphering these for me?
